description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cghjh","text":"This protocol describes the process of identifying the distribution and morphology of substance P (SP) immuno-reactive axons and terminals in the antrum, pylorus, and duodenum of mice. The antrum-pylorus-duodenum (APD) region was sectioned and immunohistochemically labeled for SP. To determine the distribution and morphology of SP-IR axons and calculate their density in different layers of APD, a Zeiss M2 Imager was used to scan each serial section. Each section was presented as a montage of approximately 50 all-in-focus maximum projection images. To determine the detailed structures of SP-IR axons and terminals, the confocal microscope was used to scan the regions of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: substance P,nociceptive afferent,myenteric plexus,longitudinal and circular muscles,submucosa,mucosa, sections, confocal microscope

Donkey Anti-rabbit IgG Affinipure Fab Fragment Alexa Fluor 488

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"60emj","text":"12 to 13-week old male    were used. The animals were housed in a room in which light/dark cycles were set to 12 h/12 h (6:00 AM to 6:00 PM light cycle) and supplied with food and water ad libitum. Animals were fasted overnight, and food was provided 2h before perfusion. A catheter was introduced during perfusion to deliver saline to ensure uniform extension of the stomach across all animals. All procedures were approved by the University of Central Florida Animal Care and Use Committee and strictly followed the guidelines established by NIH. All experiments conformed to the University of Central Florida guidelines on the ethical use of","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cqhsg","text":"animals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":182342,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Mouse cohorts for feeding","linfor":"","url":"https://www.jax.org/strain/000664","sku":"C57BL/6J","cas_number":"","rrid":"IMSR_JAX:000664","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"C0403BA0BF7411EDBDA7A961D7476EE1","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":661,"name":"The Jackson Laboratory","link":"https://www.jax.org/#","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an7au","text":"APD area from 6 animals were used for SP single labeling, and another 2 were used for SP double labeling with vesicular acetylcholine transporter (VAChT) or tyrosine hydroxylase (TH). All animals were injected (intraperitoneally) with   (0.3 ml of 3 mg/ml per animal) to counterstain neurons in the myenteric and submucosal ganglia. All IHC steps were performed on slides to preserve the original anatomical outline and avoid shape distortion which may result during tissue handling. All procedures were performed in a wet chamber and at room temperature (except for VAChT which was processed at 4 ◦C). {"blocks":[{"key":"fs38g","text":"The sections were washed 3 times in PBS (10 min each) and blocked for 24h in a blocking mixture containing 2% bovine serum albumin, 10% normal donkey serum, 2% Triton X-100, and 0.08% sodium azide in 0.1 M PBS, pH = 7.4. The tissue samples were incubated for 2 days with a mixture of primary antibodies  diluted in a solution comprising of 2% bovine serum albumin, 4% normal goat and donkey serum, 0.5% Triton X-100, and 0.08% sodium azide in 0.01 M PBS, pH = 7.4). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dubn1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gvb3","text":"To show the details of the SP, TH, and VAChT axon and varicosity distributions and projections to different targets in various layers and regions of the APD, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h4es","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8fo9g","text":"was used to acquire optical section images at high magnification (40× oil immersion objective lens, zoom X 1.5, Z-step: 1 μm). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f259","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg0mq","text":"Maximum projection images were used to show the overall innervation across the whole tissue thickness, while single optical sections revealed the details at a single cell/axon/varicosity level. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beelp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n99v","text":"The helium‑neon (HeNe) laser (excitation 543 nm) was used to detect SP-IR axons, the argon–krypton (ArKr) laser (excitation 488 nm) was used to detect TH, and VAChT, and the background autofluorescence of the tissues (e.g. smooth muscles, blood vessels, mucosal glands), and the 405 nm laser (excitation) was used for the detection and verification of FG-labeled myenteric and submucosal ganglionic neurons. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1dls","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"53m0s","text":"(https://imagej.net/, RRID: SCR_003070) and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":1,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"623i1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"beqkm","text":"(https://www.adobe.com/products/photoshop.html, RRID: SCR_014199) were used for the image processing and enhancement including brightness, contrast adjustments, and scale bar addition. All serial sections in each APD were well preserved without damage during sectioning, processing, and mounting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":1,"length":45}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3853,"brand":"Zeiss","can_edit":0,"guid":"F1C5D660BF8A11ED87320F3CF4D20C84","link":"https://www.zeiss.com/microscopy/en/products/light-microscopes/widefield-microscopes/axio-imager-2-for-life-science-research.html","name":"Axio {"blocks":[{"key":"60hja","text":"The density of the SP-IR axons was the amount of nerve signals in a defined area of tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7serp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nsv7","text":"The density analysis of SP-IR axons in the sections started by importing the montages acquired with the Zeiss M2 imager into Photoshop where the muscular layer was separated from the submucosa and mucosa. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c01uj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vr1n","text":"Each subsection was exported as a .png file into","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9no94","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"511ff","text":"(RRID: SCR_010587) where two-pixel densities (all signals and axon signals) were calculated and exported into an Excel file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iuae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5up8g","text":"The total surface area (all signals) was calculated by applying a low threshold to keep all the signals produced by muscle, ganglia, axons, or any background from the tissue. The axon signals were calculated by applying a high threshold to exclude all signals coming from the tissue and keep only the signals that were produced by SP-IR axons. The plugin Skeletonize was applied on the binarized image to ensure that axons are expressed by a centerline and the thickness of the diameter will not affect the density calculations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8f8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43asg","text":"To calculate the axon density in each region in Excel, the number of axon signal pixels was divided by the number of surface area pixels. Data are expressed as means of all samples' densities in percentages ± standard error of the mean (SEM). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27pts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7jv1","text":"Percentage data were normalized and passed the Shapiro-Wilk test before statistical analysis. One-way analysis of variance followed by all-pairwise multiple comparisons (Tukey's HSD) was used for statistical comparisons. The statistical analyses were performed using ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f4cs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agmga","text":"(version 8; GraphPad Software, Inc., RRID:SCR_002798). P \u003c 0.05 was considered statistically significant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"developer":"BioImage Analysis Lab (Institut Pasteur)","guid":"4189F400BF8C11ED87320F3CF4D20C84","id":1021,"link":"http://icy.bioimageanalysis.org","name":"Icy","os_name":"Windows/MacOS/Linux","os_version":null,"repository":"http://icy.bioimageanalysis.org","version":""}},"1":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"developer":"GraphPad","guid":"F9EB0890BF8C11ED87320F3CF4D20C84","id":658,"link":"https://www.graphpad.com/scientific-software/prism/","name":"Prism","os_name":"","os_version":"","repository":"","version":"8.0"}}}}
